annotation_1.eng: Lulu is scared of something. She is holding that book very tightly -- perhaps her fear has something to do with the book?

annotation_2.eng: What are some things that scare you?

annotation_3.eng: What do you do when you are scared? Do you go to someone or maybe find a safe place?

rows.annotation_1: Lulu is scared of something. She is holding that book very tightly -- perhaps her fear has something to do with the book?
rows.annotation_2: What are some things that scare you?
rows.annotation_3: What do you do when you are scared? Do you go to someone or maybe find a safe place?

rows.story_text: Lulu, it is time to go, calls Ma.

story_text.eng: Lulu, it is time to go, calls Ma.

annotation_1.eng: Lulu is running away from her mother. Where do you think she will hide?

annotation_2.eng: What do you think is Lulu's favorite color? How can you tell?

annotation_3.eng: Is Lulu walking or running? How can you tell?

rows.annotation_1: Lulu is running away from her mother. Where do you think she will hide?
rows.annotation_2: What do you think is Lulu's favorite color? How can you tell?
rows.annotation_3: Is Lulu walking or running? How can you tell?

rows.story_text:
Where is Lulu?

Is she under the sofa?

story_text.eng:
Where is Lulu?

Is she under the sofa?

annotation_1.eng: Lulu is hiding. Do you see Lulu?

annotation_2.eng: Count together the cushions and window panes.

annotation_3.eng: Are there more or less cushions than window panes? What is the difference -- how far apart are the two numbers?

rows.annotation_1: Lulu is hiding. Do you see Lulu?
rows.annotation_2: Count together the cushions and window panes.
rows.annotation_3: Are there more or less cushions than window panes? What is the difference -- how far apart are the two numbers?

annotation_1.eng: That's a clever disguise for Lulu. Why does her clothing make her stand out?

annotation_2.eng: Count together the number of legs on the lamp table. Do you have any tables around you with that many legs?

annotation_3.eng: The number of legs on the lamp table is one less than the number on the couch.  Three is one less than what number?

rows.annotation_1: That's a clever disguise for Lulu. Why does her clothing make her stand out?
rows.annotation_2: Count together the number of legs on the lamp table. Do you have any tables around you with that many legs?
rows.annotation_3: The number of legs on the lamp table is one less than the number on the couch.  Three is one less than what number?

rows.story_text:
Where is Lulu?

Is she next to the stove?

story_text.eng:
Where is Lulu?

Is she next to the stove?

annotation_1.eng: Guess where Lulu is hiding in the kitchen.

annotation_3.eng: Point at all the round things you can find in this kitchen -- there are quite a few.

rows.annotation_1: Guess where Lulu is hiding in the kitchen.
rows.annotation_3: Point at all the round things you can find in this kitchen -- there are quite a few.

annotation_1.eng: Once again, Lulu picked a clever hiding place, but her colors don't fit in with the colors in the kitchen.

annotation_2.eng: A rectangle is a four-sided shape like this page. Count the rectangles you see on this page.

annotation_3.eng: A cylinder is a shape like a jar with straight sides. There are five cylinders on the top shelf (the bowl is not a cylinder). How many are there on Lulu's shelf? Is it the same number?

rows.annotation_1: Once again, Lulu picked a clever hiding place, but her colors don't fit in with the colors in the kitchen.
rows.annotation_2: A rectangle is a four-sided shape like this page. Count the rectangles you see on this page.
rows.annotation_3: A cylinder is a shape like a jar with straight sides. There are five cylinders on the top shelf (the bowl is not a cylinder). How many are there on Lulu's shelf? Is it the same number?

rows.story_text: Lulu, it is time to go! Where are you? calls Ma.

story_text.eng: Lulu, it is time to go! Where are you? calls Ma.

annotation_1.eng: Lulu blends in better this time. Do you see her?

annotation_2.eng: So many things to count! Point at and count together the blocks on the floor, the dolls, and the drawings on the wall.

annotation_3.eng: Which group of things is the largest and which is the smallest?

rows.annotation_1: Lulu blends in better this time. Do you see her?
rows.annotation_2: So many things to count! Point at and count together the blocks on the floor, the dolls, and the drawings on the wall.
rows.annotation_3: Which group of things is the largest and which is the smallest?

rows.story_text:
There you are! says Ma.

"I do not want to gooo!"

story_text.eng:
There you are! says Ma.

"I do not want to gooo!"

annotation_1.eng: Lulu is still holding her book tightly. Do you think Lulu is afraid her mother will take it away?

annotation_2.eng: Lulu seems like she can be difficult when she doesn't get her way. How are you when you don't get your way?

annotation_3.eng: Lulu's room has many rectangles. How many can you count?

rows.annotation_1: Lulu is still holding her book tightly. Do you think Lulu is afraid her mother will take it away?
rows.annotation_2: Lulu seems like she can be difficult when she doesn't get her way. How are you when you don't get your way?
rows.annotation_3: Lulu's room has many rectangles. How many can you count?

rows.story_text:
We have to go, says Ma.

"But I really like this one!"

story_text.eng:
We have to go, says Ma.

"But I really like this one!"

annotation_1.eng: Lulu's book looks very big compared to Lulu. Do you think her book is really that big?

annotation_2.eng: Do you have a favorite book or story that you like to look through or have told to you? Have you heard the story many times?

annotation_3.eng: There are many kinds of stories. There are scary ones, funny ones, and some are adventures. Do you have a favorite type?

rows.annotation_1: Lulu's book looks very big compared to Lulu. Do you think her book is really that big?
rows.annotation_2: Do you have a favorite book or story that you like to look through or have told to you? Have you heard the story many times?
rows.annotation_3: There are many kinds of stories. There are scary ones, funny ones, and some are adventures. Do you have a favorite type?

rows.annotation_1: This building has many rectangles. Most buildings use rectangles a lot for their sides and windows.

annotation_1.eng: This building has many rectangles. Most buildings use rectangles a lot for their sides and windows.

annotation_2.eng: Triangles are three-sided shapes, and pentagons are five-sided shapes. There is a famous building called the Pentagon because it is made in the shape of a pentagon.

annotation_3.eng: Why do you suppose buildings are not often made in the shape of a triangle or circle? Have you seen any buildings like that?

rows.annotation_2: Triangles are three-sided shapes, and pentagons are five-sided shapes. There is a famous building called the Pentagon because it is made in the shape of a pentagon.
rows.annotation_3: Why do you suppose buildings are not often made in the shape of a triangle or circle? Have you seen any buildings like that?

rows.annotation_1: Where are they going? What does that big book on top of the building tell you about what this building is?

annotation_1.eng: Where are they going? What does that big book on top of the building tell you about what this building is?

annotation_2.eng: What is going to happen to Lulu's book at this library?

annotation_3.eng: Do you have a place where you can borrow books near where you live? Have you ever borrowed books there?

rows.annotation_2: What is going to happen to Lulu's book at this library?
rows.annotation_3: Do you have a place where you can borrow books near where you live? Have you ever borrowed books there?

annotation_1.eng: She found a new book very quickly. It didn't take Lulu long to forget about her old book.

annotation_2.eng: How does Lulu feel about this new book? How can you tell?

annotation_3.eng: The windows behind Lulu have four sides and are almost rectangles. How are they different from rectangles?

rows.annotation_1: She found a new book very quickly. It didn't take Lulu long to forget about her old book.
rows.annotation_2: How does Lulu feel about this new book? How can you tell?
rows.annotation_3: The windows behind Lulu have four sides and are almost rectangles. How are they different from rectangles?

annotation_1.eng: Lulu is a very enthusiastic person. Some people display their feelings a lot and others are quieter with them. Which are you?

annotation_2.eng: How many books do you think she will want to take home?

annotation_3.eng: Do you have a library near you? Do you like to check books out of the library?

rows.annotation_1: Lulu is a very enthusiastic person. Some people display their feelings a lot and others are quieter with them. Which are you?
rows.annotation_2: How many books do you think she will want to take home?
rows.annotation_3: Do you have a library near you? Do you like to check books out of the library?

annotation_1.eng: How many Lulus are there in this picture? Why did the artist draw more than one?

annotation_2.eng: To count as Lulu grabs books, you would keep adding "one more" each time she added a book. What is one more than zero? What is one more than one? You can count as high as you like this way!

annotation_3.eng: Libraries are supposed to be quiet places. Do you think Lulu should be running around?

rows.annotation_1: How many Lulus are there in this picture? Why did the artist draw more than one?
rows.annotation_2: To count as Lulu grabs books, you would keep adding "one more" each time she added a book. What is one more than zero? What is one more than one? You can count as high as you like this way!
rows.annotation_3: Libraries are supposed to be quiet places. Do you think Lulu should be running around?

rows.story_text:
See, you return books and borrow more, says Ma.

"YAY!"

story_text.eng:
See, you return books and borrow more, says Ma.

"YAY!"

annotation_1.eng: Why isn't Lulu sad about having to return her old book?

annotation_2.eng: Count together the books on the counter.

annotation_3.eng: How many books do you think Lulu is checking out? What is the largest number you know?

rows.annotation_1: Why isn't Lulu sad about having to return her old book?
rows.annotation_2: Count together the books on the counter.
rows.annotation_3: How many books do you think Lulu is checking out? What is the largest number you know?

annotation_1.eng: Lulu checked out a lot of books! Can you count them all?

annotation_2.eng: Do you think Lulu likes to look at and read books?

rows.annotation_1: Lulu checked out a lot of books! Can you count them all?
rows.annotation_2: Do you think Lulu likes to look at and read books?
